executive_summary: Auto mechanics provide mechanical and electrical repair and maintenance for a variety of vehicles, including cars, trucks and vans. Over the five years to 2023, the industry experienced moderate growth. The number of vehicles on the road has expanded, along with the average age of the vehicle fleet, however a fall in consumer confidence has made consumers postpone car repair and maintenance services. Revenue growth was significantly disrupted in 2020 by the outbreak of COVID-19, as a sharp decline in total vehicle mileage reduced the need for car repairs overall. Revenue quickly recovered, supported by rising consumer confidence levels. Overall, revenue is expected to rise at a CAGR of 0.5% to $81.7 billion over the five years to 2023, including an increase of 1.7% in 2023.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: COVID-19 and the Subsequent Economic Downturn Lead to Significant Disruption
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Though repair shops were deemed essential businesses and permitted to remain open, many were forced to downsize operations to follow social-distancing regulations. Supply chain disruptions and inflationary pressures contributed to the rising cost of car parts and required equipment for mechanics.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Demand for Car Servicing is Somewhat Evergreen
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Demand for certain industry services maintains stability in the long run despite disruptions, thanks to the heavy use of cars and trucks in the US. A reliable consumer base has ensured revenue growth in the last five years.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Small Shops Have Been Getting Acquired at an Increasing Rate
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Since many mechanics are able to operate their businesses on their own, there is high fragmentation in this industry, with nonemployer establishments accounting for nearly 70.0% of businesses.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Industry will experience growth as the economy normalizes
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Consumer confidence will grow significantly, which will encourage customers who have been avoiding car and truck repair and maintenance due to financial considerations to pay for these services.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Several factors will contribute to a decline in overall driving
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: While the world price of crude oil is forecast to decline through the years to 2028, expected price volatility will likely affect consumer demand for industry services.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: A shortage of qualified auto technicians is expected
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Younger generations are losing interest in auto mechanics as a profession, while those who are interested struggle to find proper automotive technician training programs.
A shift towards subscription-based vehicle maintenance services will reshape how mechanics engage with customers.

industry_definition: The Auto Mechanics industry provides mechanical and electrical repair and maintenance for cars, trucks, vans and trailers. Operators include self-employed mechanics, auto repair shops, garages and car care centers.

negative_impact_factors: Low barriers to entry level - steady

key_trends: Auto mechanics provide mechanical and electrical repair and maintenance for a variety of vehicles, including cars, trucks, vans and trailers.
The Auto Mechanics industry is anticipated to continue gradually recovering from setbacks experienced following the COVID-19 pandemic and experience steadier revenue growth.
Industry operators must abide by state laws that might be more stringent than applicable federal regulations.
The Auto Mechanics industry receives little assistance and is not directly affected by tariffs or duties.
Essential services tend to keep revenue from declining too much.
The largest market for industry services are households and consumers with limited funds who can't readily replace vehicles.
The Auto Mechanics industry has a very low level of concentration and is highly fragmented.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Higher disposable income enables individuals to afford repair services.
Services provided to consumers aged 45 to 64 years old.
Customers in this segment include a variety of nonprofit organizations.
Customers in this segment include law enforcement agencies and other government entities.

products_and_services.product_description: Services under this segment include basic car maintenance.
The powertrain of a motor vehicle includes all of the major parts required for the vehicle to run.
Drivers are most often able to detect when their car's brakes are not working properly.
Services like muffler and exhaust repair.

FAQs.question: How have your company's sales been affected by the economic downturn amid the COVID-19 pandemic?
FAQs.answer: The Auto Mechanics industry experienced a decline in revenue following the onset of COVID-19.
